original: Oscar Arvid Theodor, tf. överläkare, förste läkare, Västervik, f. 22/8/98 i Ödeshög, Östergötl. 1., av fanj. Theodor W. o. Anna Karlsson. G. 36 m. gymn :dir. Märta Elmer. Barn: Gudrun f. 36, Hans 37, Ulf 3g, Leif-Arvid 43. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 18, med. kand. i Upps. 24, msed. lic. i Sthlm 29. Banktj:man 18-19. Assist :läk. o. vik. aman. v. psykiatr. klin. i Sthlm 27, e. läk. v. Säters hosp. 29’-CO, e. o. andre läk. v. Sundiby sjukh. 30-31, e. läk. där 3i2, assist :läk. o. tf. und :läk. v. Linköp. las. med. avd. 31-32, andre läk. v. Sundby sjukh. 32-35, därunder tf. förste läk. sex mån., tf. överläk. av tredje kl. v. Säters sjukh. tre mån. 313’, förste läk. v. S :ta Gert-ruds sjukh. i Västervik sed. 36, därunder tf. överläk. av tredje kl. tre mån. årl., ibitr, sjukv:läk. v. sinnes-sjukavd. å fångv:anst. i Västervik 37, ord. dito s. å., tf. överläk. där sed. 45. , Bror Julius Otto, ingenjör, Göteborg, f. 29/7/75 i Gbg av köpm. Carl Bdw^ard W. o. Olga Green. G. m. Elin Pettersson. Barn: Margareta f. 21, g. m. Kjell Bililner, Gbg. — Ut-ex. fr. CTI 98, stud. i uti. Chef f. A-B Gbgs Hartsoljefärgfabrik sed. 01. Passiv medl. av Gbigs friv. motorbåtsflottilj, styr:le’d. i Gbgs Kungl. Segelsällsk. nio år samt ordf. i Gbgs motorbåts-sällsk. -elva år, numera hed :Oirdf. i det sistn. GKSiSftjM.
translated: Oscar Arvid Theodor, acting chief physician, first physician, Västervik, b. 22/8/98 in Ödeshög, Östergötland. Son of infantryman Theodor W. and Anna Karlsson. Married in 1936 to gymnastics director Märta Elmer. Children: Gudrun, b. 1936; Hans, b. 1937; Ulf, b. 1930; Leif-Arvid, b. 1943. Academic achievements: Graduated from high school in Linköping in 1918, completed medical studies in Uppsala in 1924, obtained a medical license in Stockholm in 1929. Work experience: Worked in banking from 1918-1919. Assistant doctor and substitute assistant at the psychiatric clinic in Stockholm in 1927, resident doctor at Säter Hospital from 1929-1930, assistant doctor at Sundby Hospital from 1930-1931, chief doctor at Sundby Hospital from 1932-1935, including a six-month stint as acting chief doctor. Assistant doctor and acting deputy doctor at the medical department of Linköping Hospital from 1931-1932. Chief doctor at S:ta Gertrud's Hospital in Västervik since 1936, including a three-month period as acting chief doctor of third class each year. Also serves as a medical officer at the psychiatric ward of Västervik Prison since 1937. Brother Julius Otto, engineer, Gothenburg, b. 29/7/75 in Gothenburg, son of merchant Carl Edward W. and Olga Green. Married to Elin Pettersson. Children: Margareta, b. 1921, married to Kjell Bililner from Gothenburg. Graduated from CTI in 1898, studied abroad. Became the head of A-B Gothenburg's Tar Oil Paint Factory in 1901. Passive member of Gothenburg's voluntary motorboat flotilla, board member of Gothenburg Royal Sailing Society for nine years, and chairman of Gothenburg's motorboat society for eleven years. Currently the honorary chairman of the latter society.
